notes: SUMMARY: Captain Marvel fights the white supremacist Sons of the Serpent and a villain named Skinhead, on the campus of Empire State University.

Comic books, strips, etc. 3. College students

43.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
43.title: "Bad Tommy"
43.author: story, Robert McKenzie and Nicola Cuti ; art, Martin Salvador
notes: "That Tommy was a mean one and the awful things he did forced people to wonder if the little monster was truly human. He hadn't always been bad. What caused him to change? It was Miss Abbie's job to find out."

47.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
47.title: "Coggin's Army"
47.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Martin Salvador
notes: "From Cosgrove's POW Complex, it was difficult to do more than endure. The General, however, had to prove himself a hero or lose command of everything!"

52.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
52.title: "Demon's Rage!"
52.author: Roger McKenzie, script and co-plot ; Don Perlin, art and co-plot ; Bob Layton, inks
52.appears_in: 17 p. in Ghost Rider, no. 31 (Aug. 1978) k. Rage. I. McKenzie, Roger. II. Perlin, Don. III. Layton, Bob. Call no.: PN6728.4.M3G33no.31

53.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
53.title: "Dollie"
53.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leopold Sanchez
notes: "The dream of a white Christmas faded into the nightmare of a black Christmas. All over the world, deadly toys were being left beneath the holiday trees. Dollie was the key and deadliest of all!"

54.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
54.title: "Elixer"
54.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leopold Sanchez
notes: "Rocketing along the ice with swinging sticks, hockey wasn't a sport for any man past his prime. And Ed Binder was an old man. Nevertheless, to defend his goal one more time, Ed chose to drink the magic and dangerous elixer!"

55.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
55.title: "Evil is the Orb!"
55.author: Roger McKenzie, words ; Perlin and Sutton, pictures ; McCarron and Marcos, inks
55.appears_in: 17 p. in Ghost Rider, no. 28 (Feb. 1978) k. The Orb. I. McKenzie, Roger. II. Perlin, Don. III. Sutton, Tom. IV. McCarron. V. Marcos, Pablo. Call no.: PN6728.4.M3G33no.28

56.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
56.title: "Funeral Day"
56.author: McKenzie ; José Ortiz
notes: Data from Jerry Sinkovec.

57.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
57.title: "A Game of Hide and Seek"
57.author: McKenzie ; Durañona
notes: Data from Jerry Sinkovec.

58.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
58.title: "The Generations of Noah"
58.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leo Duranona
notes: "Noah had eight minutes to find a human male and female to save from a doomed Earth. He only wanted two but there was a third!"

59.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
59.title: "A Gift for Momma"
59.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Luis Bermejo
notes: "Johnny hated what his step-father had done to Momma. So, he and his brother, Ben, had planned a lovely present for her. It involved an axe and dad!"

60.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
60.title: "The Greatest Christmas of All"
60.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leo Duranona
notes: "Louis didn't look much like Santa Claus, but who can say? He had a present for everyone, even his cruel Poppa. What a gift that was!"
Contents page title: "The Grandest Christmas."

61.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
61.title: "Hitter's Wind!"
61.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Carmine Infantino and Walt Simonson
notes: "The Bearcats were a second-rate pre-depression black team. Till Willie Mountain led them to victory after victory. And the rumors started about Willie's deal with the devil!"
Baseball story.

62.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
62.title: "Home Stretch"
62.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leopold Sanchez
notes: "Renegade would've been a Derby winner for sure, if anyone had been able to ride him. As it was, he was insured for fifty thousand dollars. And he would be most valuable dead!"
Horseracing story.

63.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
63.title: "The Last"
63.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, John Severin
notes: "Coff had played the crazy charade too many times. Its true origin was lost to the last Martian on Mars. Choff was the last but he was not the last Martian!"

64.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
64.title: "The Last Dragon King"
64.author: Roger McKenzie ; Esteban Maroto
notes: Data from Jerry Sinkovec.

65.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
65.title: "Lenore"
65.author: Roger McKenzie ; José González
notes: Data from Jerry Sinkovec.

66.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
66.title: "Like Icarus, Quickly Falling"
66.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leopold Sanchez
notes: "Trippitz has been hunting the vampire who had destroyed his sweet Marie. The showdown finally arrived, thousands of years later! Often, it takes a vampire to kill a vampire!"
Contents page title: "Like Icarus Falling."

67.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
67.title: "Little Monsters"
67.author: McKenzie ; Infantino & Giordano
notes: Data from Jerry Sinkovec.

68.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
68.title: "The Mage and the Monster!"
68.author: Roger McKenzie, script/co-plot ; Don Perlin, art/co-plot ; Jim Mooney, inks
68.appears_in: 17 p. in Ghost Rider, no. 30 (June 1978) k. Monsters. I. McKenzie, Roger. II. Perlin, Don. III. Mooney, Jim. Call no.: PN6728.4.M3G33no.30

69.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
69.title: "Me & Rod, Sun Running in the Twilight Zone"
69.author: Roger McKenzie
69.appears_in: p. 47-49 in The Comics Journal, no. 106 (Mar. 1986)
notes: Review of Sun Runners.
Data from Pete Coogan.

70.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
70.title: "The Mummy's Victory"
70.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Rich Corben
notes: "'Rah!' the crowd called. And the centuries old mummy answered. Legend said that he would rise again when victory was needed. And Cloverton needed a football hero now!"

71.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
71.title: "One Hell of a War"
71.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leo Duranona
notes: "Suddenly, without warning, the Tregelian ships had appeared in space, right outside the Moon's orbit. They were fast, deadly, and their mission was to destroy. It was up to Charlie to stop them!"

72.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
72.title: "The Plot's The Thing"
72.author: McKenzie ; Martin Salvador
notes: Data from Jerry Sinkovec.

73.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
73.title: "The Price!"
73.author: Roger McKenzie, script and co-plot ; Don Perlin, pencils and co-plot ; Rick Bryant, inks
73.appears_in: 17 p. in Ghost Rider, no. 32 (Oct. 1978) I. McKenzie, Roger. II. Perlin, Don. III. Bryant, Rick. Call no.: PN6728.4.M3G33no.32

74.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
74.title: "Relic"
74.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Carmine Infantino and John Severin
notes: "Jackie-7 was a relic, a clanking metal hulk left over from the time whan men first relinquished the game of baseball to robots, machines that played for keeps with bats and live grenades!"

75.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
75.title: "The Replacement"
75.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Carmine Infantino & Dick Giordano
notes: "A light dropped from the sky in the midst of the Whizzers Baseball Team's crucial game and whisked away their pitcher. In his place was a strange humanoid! And man, could that alien play baseball!"

76.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
76.title: "The Return of Rah"
76.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Carmine Infantino & John Severin
notes: "Rah had kept his promise to awaken when the world needed a champion. Once the mummy led Cloverton to victory in football, securing the pigskin as a trophy. Now he rises again to play pro ball all wrapped up in a love affair!"

77.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
77.title: "Running Wild"
77.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Carmine Infantino & Alex Nino
notes: "Though Walt and Lucien were twins, Walt was athletic while Lucien was confined to a wheelchair. As twins, they were closer than most brothers, yet the ties which bound them were Lucien's will and Walt's hate!"

78.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
78.title: "Sacrifice"
78.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Luis Bermejo
78.appears_in: p. 39-46 in Creepy, no. 94 (Jan. 1978) ; reprinted in Creepy, no. 146 (1985).
notes: "They were just a group of kids fooling around with dark sorcery. Only Damien was completely serious about the rites and especially the sacrifices. He knew it was more than a game. It was life, but also death!"

79.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
79.title: "The Search"
79.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Carmine Infantino and Gonzalo Mayo
notes: "Night after horrible night the blood lusting monster sought out a fresh young girl to quench his insatiable thirst. Yet the vampire's jaunts might soon end. Closing in on him was another killer!"

80.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
80.title: "Spider-Man and Black Widow"
80.author: Marv Wolfman, Roger McKenzie, script ; Will Meugniot, pencils ; Bruce D
80.appears_in: Patterson, inks ; Diana Albers, colors ; Bob Sharen, letters. 17 p. in Marvel Team-Up, no. 98 (Oct. 1980).
notes: Untitled teamup of Spider-Man & Black Widow, vs. The Owl and The Maggia.
Data from Bob Klein via Grand Comics Database Project.

82.title: Stan Lee Presents Battlestar Galactica. vol. 2

83.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
83.title: "The Terrible Turnip of Turpin County"
83.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Martin Salvador
notes: "It was a prize winner for sure. The biggest turnip Charlie had ever seen. Too big to be from God's good earth and its hunger was unnatural. But all God's children gotta eat!"
Contents page title: "Terrible Turpin Turnip."

84.heading: McKenzie, Roger.
84.title: "The Thing in the Well"
84.author: story, Roger McKenzie ; art, Leo Duranona
notes: "It was on that cold Maine night, a year ago, it happened. Most of what Nancy remembered was a vague nightmare. But at least it gave Nancy a friend. A friend who lived in the well!"

85.author: by Roger McKenzie ; illustrated by Luis Eduardo Barreto.
